{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3338498,"name":"","username":"tconrad","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/tconrad/{size}/224348_2.png","created_at":"2024-03-20T16:36:01.347Z","cooked":"

Hi,

We were running autos and ran into a pretty mystifying issue. Whenever we tested our auto by running the “Autonomous” mode on our driver station the auto ran completely normally and scored all the pieces. However, when the auto runs in “Practice” mode (which we were told by a csa is intended to replicate the way the fms would communicate with the driver station) it lags for ~1.5 seconds at the very beginning. We attempted to disable as many things as possible to try and determine the root cause of the lag (short of turning off the drivetrain) but we could not fix the issue in Practice mode. I’m wondering if anyone has any insights about what may be causing this / how exactly the practice mode and fms communicates with the driver station.

Thanks!

","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":23,"updated_at":"2024-03-20T16:36:01.347Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":112,"reads":271,"readers_count":270,"score":619.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":459460,"topic_slug":"autonomous-lag-in-practice-mode","display_username":"","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":59523,"hidden":false,"trust_level":1,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Team 8 Technical Director"},"post_url":"/t/autonomous-lag-in-practice-mode/459460/1","custom_user_title":"Team 8 Technical Director","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null,"can_vote":false},{"id":3338517,"name":"Rahul Yarlagadda","username":"Knufire","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/knufire/{size}/67820_2.png","created_at":"2024-03-20T16:48:04.911Z","cooked":"

You can try using VisualVM to see if there’s a specific part of the user code that is hanging: Profiling with VisualVM — FIRST Robotics Competition documentation

","post_number":2,"post_type":1,"posts_count":23,"updated_at":"2024-03-20T16:48:04.911Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":251,"readers_count":250,"score":50.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":459460,"topic_slug":"autonomous-lag-in-practice-mode","display_username":"Rahul Yarlagadda","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://docs.wpilib.org/en/stable/docs/software/advanced-gradlerio/profiling-with-visualvm.html","internal":false,"reflection":false,"title":"Profiling with VisualVM — FIRST Robotics Competition documentation","clicks":14}],"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":12760,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"7457 Mentor"},"post_url":"/t/autonomous-lag-in-practice-mode/459460/2","custom_user_title":"7457 Mentor","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3338524,"name":"Ankur Raghavan","username":"Ankur-Raghavan","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/ankur-raghavan/{size}/207141_2.png","created_at":"2024-03-20T16:50:30.245Z","cooked":"

Are you sure that the lag occurs after autonomous enables? By default there is a 3 second countdown on practice mode.

","post_number":3,"post_type":1,"posts_count":23,"updated_at":"2024-03-20T16:50:30.245Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":3,"reads":240,"readers_count":239,"score":78.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":459460,"topic_slug":"autonomous-lag-in-practice-mode","display_username":"Ankur Raghavan","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":5}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":50601,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"5⁵-4⁴"},"post_url":"/t/autonomous-lag-in-practice-mode/459460/3","custom_user_title":"5⁵-4⁴","reactions":[{"id":"point_up","type":"emoji","count":4},{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":5,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3338528,"name":"","username":"tails618","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/tails618/{size}/188357_2.png","created_at":"2024-03-20T16:53:05.464Z","cooked":"

What do you mean by “lag?” Is their just a period between when you hit enable and when the robot starts doing anything? That feels like the (customizable) countdown in the drive station software. If that’s not it, you could also look at the usual culprits in the driver’s station log (CPU usage, trip time, et cetera) to try to identify what’s causing your slowdown.

If lag means the robot is actually functioning differently, that’s a lot weirder and I think we’d need more details.

","post_number":4,"post_type":1,"posts_count":23,"updated_at":"2024-03-20T16:53:05.464Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":5,"reads":225,"readers_count":224,"score":70.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":459460,"topic_slug":"autonomous-lag-in-practice-mode","display_username":"","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":53201,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"8096A"},"post_url":"/t/autonomous-lag-in-practice-mode/459460/4","custom_user_title":"8096A","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3338529,"name":"Gavin Matthews","username":"bovlb","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/bovlb/{size}/167232_2.png","created_at":"2024-03-20T16:53:54.570Z","cooked":"

Check your DS logs to see if there are any “loop overrun” messages. The details are a little hard to read, but you should be able to see if one particular routine (e.g. autonomousInit) is taking up too much time (from the budget of 0.02s).

One issue I’m hearing a lot about this year is that autonomous is slow to start because of lazy java classloading. I don’t know if you’re using PathPlanner, but they recently added a warm up method.

","post_number":5,"post_type":1,"posts_count":23,"updated_at":"2024-03-20T16:53:54.570Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":4,"reads":209,"readers_count":208,"score":61.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":459460,"topic_slug":"autonomous-lag-in-practice-mode","display_username":"Gavin Matthews","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://pathplanner.dev/pplib-pathfinding.html#java-warmup","internal":false,"reflection":false,"title":"Pathfinding | PathPlanner Docs","clicks":23},{"url":"https://docs.wpilib.org/en/stable/docs/software/driverstation/driver-station-log-viewer.html","internal":false,"reflection":false,"title":"Driver Station Log File Viewer — FIRST Robotics Competition documentation","clicks":2}],"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":38743,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Programming mentor, Team 2102, RI, CSA (he/him)"},"post_url":"/t/autonomous-lag-in-practice-mode/459460/5","custom_user_title":"Programming mentor, Team 2102, RI, CSA (he/him)","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3338533,"name":"Stephen Kalogiannis ","username":"sk2983","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/sk2983/{size}/135585_2.png","created_at":"2024-03-20T16:55:15.682Z","cooked":"

you might be referring to the 3 sec countdown, if you have volume on your driver station the robot should only start moving after the whistle sound is presented.

","post_number":6,"post_type":1,"posts_count":23,"updated_at":"2024-03-20T16:55:15.682Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":190,"readers_count":189,"score":38.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":459460,"topic_slug":"autonomous-lag-in-practice-mode","display_username":"Stephen Kalogiannis ","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":18265,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/autonomous-lag-in-practice-mode/459460/6","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3338545,"name":"Joshua J","username":"thatnameistaken","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/t/57b2e6/{size}.png","created_at":"2024-03-20T17:00:53.719Z","cooked":"
tconrad:

However, when the auto runs in “Practice” mode (which we were told by a csa is intended to replicate the way the fms would communicate with the driver station) it lags for ~1.5 seconds at the very beginning.

To my knowledge, practice mode is just a fancy timer. It doesn’t actually change how anything is communicated, other than ensuring a 5 second auto to teleop transition. It certainly doesn’t simulate the FMS, you’d need more networking hardware for that.

","post_number":7,"post_type":1,"posts_count":23,"updated_at":"2024-03-20T17:00:53.719Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":1,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":168,"readers_count":167,"score":58.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":459460,"topic_slug":"autonomous-lag-in-practice-mode","display_username":"Joshua J","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":19116,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"CSA | Drive Coach (2191)"},"post_url":"/t/autonomous-lag-in-practice-mode/459460/7","custom_user_title":"CSA | Drive Coach (2191)","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3338582,"name":"","username":"tconrad","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/tconrad/{size}/224348_2.png","created_at":"2024-03-20T17:27:22.535Z","cooked":"

We’re aware of the three second practice mode delay and that is not the cause of the issue.

We considered the possibility that the issue may have been caused by loop overrun— we significantly optimized our code and have reduced their frequency significantly. We still experience occasional overruns that are fairly insignificant (0.03-0.04 sec) and they are not severe enough to lag the robot for the 0.5 seconds that we experience.

What’s particularly frustrating is that the issue only happens in Practice mode on the driver station, never in autonomous mode, so we think that the issue is somehow linked to how the code is run in practice mode. My personal theory is that this is somehow linked with packet loss in practice mode.

","post_number":8,"post_type":1,"posts_count":23,"updated_at":"2024-03-20T17:27:22.535Z","reply_count":3,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":2,"reads":136,"readers_count":135,"score":52.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":459460,"topic_slug":"autonomous-lag-in-practice-mode","display_username":"","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":59523,"hidden":false,"trust_level":1,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Team 8 Technical Director"},"post_url":"/t/autonomous-lag-in-practice-mode/459460/8","custom_user_title":"Team 8 Technical Director","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3338624,"name":"","username":"tails618","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/tails618/{size}/188357_2.png","created_at":"2024-03-20T17:52:10.011Z","cooked":"

I wouldn’t say 0.03-0.04s is insignificant considering a cycle is 0.02s, personally.

Are you actually seeing packet loss in practice mode that you aren’t in autonomous mode? That shouldn’t be happening, the connection should be the same.

","post_number":9,"post_type":1,"posts_count":23,"updated_at":"2024-03-20T17:52:10.011Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":8,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":121,"readers_count":120,"score":29.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":459460,"topic_slug":"autonomous-lag-in-practice-mode","display_username":"","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":59523,"username":"tconrad","name":"","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/tconrad/{size}/224348_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":53201,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"8096A"},"post_url":"/t/autonomous-lag-in-practice-mode/459460/9","custom_user_title":"8096A","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3338687,"name":"Andy Gasser","username":"gdefender","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/gdefender/{size}/168507_2.png","created_at":"2024-03-20T18:29:49.005Z","cooked":"

I think you need to explain what you mean by “lag”, it’s not clear and people are making assumptions about what you mean.

  • Do you mean there’s a delay in the time between clicking ENABLE and the robot becoming enabled?
  • Do you mean there’s a delay in the time between the robot becoming enabled in autonomous and it starting to move?
  • Do you mean after autonomous there is a delay before the robot becomes enabled in teleop?
  • Do you mean after autonomous when the robot becomes enabled in teleop, there’s a delay before you can drive the robot?
  • Do you mean after autonomous, the driver’s controls have high latency in teleop?
","post_number":10,"post_type":1,"posts_count":23,"updated_at":"2024-03-20T18:29:49.005Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":8,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":100,"readers_count":99,"score":55.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":459460,"topic_slug":"autonomous-lag-in-practice-mode","display_username":"Andy Gasser","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":59523,"username":"tconrad","name":"","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/tconrad/{size}/224348_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":2}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":44380,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"7028 - Java Programming Mentor"},"post_url":"/t/autonomous-lag-in-practice-mode/459460/10","custom_user_title":"7028 - Java Programming Mentor","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":2}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":2,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3338694,"name":"Tyson Whelan","username":"Tyson453","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/t/e56c9b/{size}.png","created_at":"2024-03-20T18:33:48.849Z","cooked":"

When you enable in practice mode, there should be a countdown (inaudible but if your hand is by the laptop you can feel it). Not sure how long this countdown is but I think it’s a little more than 3 seconds. Once the timer on the driver station application starts counting from 0-15, that’s when auto starts. There is also a 3 second wait between auto and teleop.

","post_number":11,"post_type":1,"posts_count":23,"updated_at":"2024-03-20T18:33:48.849Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":95,"readers_count":94,"score":24.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":459460,"topic_slug":"autonomous-lag-in-practice-mode","display_username":"Tyson Whelan","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":51010,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"2357 Drive Coach"},"post_url":"/t/autonomous-lag-in-practice-mode/459460/11","custom_user_title":"2357 Drive Coach","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3338710,"name":"Jake Garlits","username":"iBleedBlue48","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/ibleedblue48/{size}/251462_2.png","created_at":"2024-03-20T18:44:49.833Z","cooked":"

Are you running unneeded code in autonomousInit()? Our team had a command running in autonomousInit to set the position of our shooter deck. It was unneeded, since the deck was already at the position being commanded, but it caused about a second of delay for our robot ONLY when we ran the robot in practice mode (and on the field at our first competition)

","post_number":12,"post_type":1,"posts_count":23,"updated_at":"2024-03-20T18:44:49.833Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":86,"readers_count":85,"score":22.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":459460,"topic_slug":"autonomous-lag-in-practice-mode","display_username":"Jake Garlits","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":27417,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"FRC 1501 Java Mentor / Alumni"},"post_url":"/t/autonomous-lag-in-practice-mode/459460/12","custom_user_title":"FRC 1501 Java Mentor / Alumni","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3338714,"name":"Andy Gasser","username":"gdefender","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/gdefender/{size}/168507_2.png","created_at":"2024-03-20T18:46:56.255Z","cooked":"
Tyson453:

When you enable in practice mode, there should be a countdown (inaudible but if your hand is by the laptop you can feel it). Not sure how long this countdown is but I think it’s a little more than 3 seconds. Once the timer on the driver station application starts counting from 0-15, that’s when auto starts. There is also a 3 second wait between auto and teleop.

The countdown makes beeping noises if you have the laptop volume up. The countdown, delay, and sounds are all configurable in Driver Station

iBleedBlue48:

it caused about a second of delay for our robot ONLY when we ran the robot in practice mode

Can you explain why having code in autonomousInit() only caused delay in practice mode, but no delay when you ran in Autonomous mode? Both invoke autonomousInit().

","post_number":14,"post_type":1,"posts_count":23,"updated_at":"2024-03-20T18:48:43.276Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":12,"quote_count":1,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":77,"readers_count":76,"score":20.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":459460,"topic_slug":"autonomous-lag-in-practice-mode","display_username":"Andy Gasser","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":44380,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"7028 - Java Programming Mentor"},"post_url":"/t/autonomous-lag-in-practice-mode/459460/14","custom_user_title":"7028 - Java Programming Mentor","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3338725,"name":"Thad House","username":"Thad_House","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/t/a4c791/{size}.png","created_at":"2024-03-20T18:50:06.891Z","cooked":"

That’s all the FMS does anyway. Practice mode runs everything in the same order the FMS would. The FMS only communicates with the DS anyway, and the DS is what commands the Robot. There is no difference there between field and home use.

","post_number":15,"post_type":1,"posts_count":23,"updated_at":"2024-03-20T18:50:06.891Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":7,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":73,"readers_count":72,"score":14.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":459460,"topic_slug":"autonomous-lag-in-practice-mode","display_username":"Thad House","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":19116,"username":"thatnameistaken","name":"Joshua J","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/t/57b2e6/{size}.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":16147,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"WPILib Dev | 2025 VOTY"},"post_url":"/t/autonomous-lag-in-practice-mode/459460/15","custom_user_title":"WPILib Dev | 2025 VOTY","reactions":[{"id":"point_up","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3338729,"name":"Thad House","username":"Thad_House","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/t/a4c791/{size}.png","created_at":"2024-03-20T18:52:44.508Z","cooked":"

Are you restarting code every time you’re manually enabling autonomous mode? If not, you’re not simulating what happens on the field. Enabling, disabling, then reenabling autonomous mode will likely not show the same delays. Generally we see delays caused by loading paths in AutonomousInit. The first time you load a JSON library on the roboRIO (Which happens when you grab the field layout), that takes about 2 seconds to run. If you don’t do that until one of the init functions, it will look like the robot is lagging.

","post_number":16,"post_type":1,"posts_count":23,"updated_at":"2024-03-20T18:57:51.758Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":8,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":3,"reads":71,"readers_count":70,"score":49.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":459460,"topic_slug":"autonomous-lag-in-practice-mode","display_username":"Thad House","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":2,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":59523,"username":"tconrad","name":"","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/tconrad/{size}/224348_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":16147,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"WPILib Dev | 2025 VOTY"},"post_url":"/t/autonomous-lag-in-practice-mode/459460/16","custom_user_title":"WPILib Dev | 2025 VOTY","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3338757,"name":"","username":"tconrad","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/tconrad/{size}/224348_2.png","created_at":"2024-03-20T19:12:23.553Z","cooked":"

In both instances, we are following the same series of steps before enabling:

  1. Deploy robot code.
  2. Turn robot off.
  3. Lift robot to correct position on the field.
  4. Turn on robot.
  5. Enable practice mode / autonomous mode.
    We will look into whether the paths being loaded could be the issue, but the lag occurs during autonomousPeriodic, not during autonomousInit.
","post_number":17,"post_type":1,"posts_count":23,"updated_at":"2024-03-20T19:12:23.553Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":16,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":67,"readers_count":66,"score":13.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":459460,"topic_slug":"autonomous-lag-in-practice-mode","display_username":"","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"reply_to_user":{"id":16147,"username":"Thad_House","name":"Thad House","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/t/a4c791/{size}.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":59523,"hidden":false,"trust_level":1,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Team 8 Technical Director"},"post_url":"/t/autonomous-lag-in-practice-mode/459460/17","custom_user_title":"Team 8 Technical Director","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3338819,"name":"","username":"tconrad","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/tconrad/{size}/224348_2.png","created_at":"2024-03-20T20:07:57.135Z","cooked":"

When the robot is first enabled in practice mode, the following things occur:

  1. The flywheels begin to spin up and the odometry resets. This part of the routine does not lag and essentially executes instantly.
  2. The preloaded ring is launched by running the indexer at this point. Once again, this part of the code does not lag.
  3. The first path (preloaded with Pathplanner) begins to run. About one second into its execution, the path begins to behave erratically: when the lag begins, the robot continues running with whatever heading and velocity it had when it began to lag, leading it to deviate from the path. After the lagging period ends, the robot then corrects its path and drives to the correct point.
  4. After this, the auto proceeds normally, without lag for the remainder of autonomous periodic and teleop periodic.
    Once again, this issue only occurred when running the robot on practice mode, and it functioned normally when running in autonomous mode.

Can you share your code?
I would expect you’re probably getting loop overruns when that happens. Checking the logs can be really helpful in that case.

It could have been that we only really noticed it during practice mode, since we are racing the 15 second countdown. Either way, that was the cause of our delay at the start of auto, and the delay we were experiencing went away after removing that command from autonomousInit()
